president_economic.description: The benefits appeal but timeline concerns remain
Some aspects raise questions but overall positive
The economic projections seem overly optimistic
Your figures contradict government economic forecasts
Presentation appears detached from economic realities

president_timeline.description: Timeline conflicts with other national projects
Timeline appears politically motivated rather than practical

president_financial.description: Models fail to account for sovereign debt implications

finance_roi.description: Time horizon for returns appears optimistic
Risk factors inadequately incorporated in models
Fundamental flaws in financial assumptions identified

finance_debt.description: Debt service metrics within acceptable parameters
Some debt concerns but generally acceptable
Proposal would trigger debt covenant violations

finance_models.description: Financing approach fundamentally misaligned with fiscal policy

infra_tech.description: Technical approach aligns with ministry standards
Specifications fail to meet regulatory requirements

infra_challenges.description: Challenges acknowledged but solutions need work
Challenge assessment reveals fundamental feasibility issues

infra_local.description: Approach conflicts with national procurement policy

parliament_economic.description: Economic impact study impresses across parties
Economic analysis accepted with partisan divisions
Economic methodology questioned by budget committee
Economic impact study undermined by contradictory data

parliament_legal.description: Legal approach accepted with amendments needed
Legal framework conflicts with existing statutes

parliament_concerns.description: Social impact approach resonates with lawmakers
Some concerns addressed but others remain

local_consultation.description: Consultation approach sets new standard for engagement
Consultation appears symbolic rather than substantial
Consultation process exacerbates existing community tensions

local_employment.description: Employment plan accepted but skills gaps identified
Employment benefits skewed toward outside workers

local_land.description: Land approach acceptable but questions remain
Approach triggers significant land rights protests

env_mitigation.description: Mitigation strategy sets new environmental standard

env_monitoring.description: Program structurally inadequate for ecosystem complexity
Monitoring approach fundamentally misaligned with ecological needs

quizQuestions.question: Which economic challenge will the project most directly address?
What is the project's most significant economic risk factor?
Which economic sector stands to gain the most competitive advantage?
How will the project likely impact national borrowing rates?
What economic strategy does this project best align with?
What is the most significant environmental mitigation challenge?
Which environmental impact requires the most comprehensive monitoring?
What climate change scenario poses the greatest threat to project viability?
Which renewable alternative was determined less viable than this project?
What environmental benefit offers the strongest case for the project?
Which demographic will experience the most significant lifestyle changes?
What social infrastructure investment is most critical for project success?
Which potential social tension requires the most careful management?
What social benefit has the highest quantifiable economic value?
Which community engagement strategy has proven most effective?
What governance approach best balances all stakeholder interests?
Which financing structure provides optimal risk distribution?
What is the most strategic long-term benefit beyond power generation?
Which international development goal does the project most directly advance?
What strategic timing factor most significantly affects project success?

keyClauses.title: Local Contractor Requirement
keyClauses.summary: 75% of contractors must be Chinese companies.

keyClauses.title: Collateral Escrow
keyClauses.summary: 40% of project revenue pledged to escrow until full repayment.

keyClauses.title: Environmental Reporting
keyClauses.summary: Minimal reporting obligations; annual self-audit.

keyClauses.title: Acceleration
keyClauses.summary: Lender may declare full loan balance immediately due upon any default event.

keyClauses.title: Borrower Cancellation
keyClauses.summary: Limited ability to cancel loan with 3% cancellation penalty.

keyClauses.title: Confidentiality
keyClauses.summary: All loan terms strictly confidential; disclosure prohibited without written consent.

keyClauses.title: Cross-Default
keyClauses.summary: Default on any major external debt triggers default on this loan.

keyClauses.title: Escrow Account
keyClauses.summary: Project revenue directed through Chinese-managed escrow account.

keyClauses.title: Immunity Waiver
keyClauses.summary: Waiver of sovereign immunity for project assets and arbitration.

keyClauses.title: Negative Pledge
keyClauses.summary: Borrower cannot pledge project assets to other creditors.

keyClauses.title: Revenue Account
keyClauses.summary: All project revenue flows through designated account controlled by lender.

keyClauses.title: Underlying Contract
keyClauses.summary: Loan contingent on engagement of Chinese EPC contractor.

keyClauses.title: Environmental Compliance
keyClauses.summary: Quarterly independent audits on environmental standards.

keyClauses.title: Contractor Selection
keyClauses.summary: No nationality restrictions on contractors.

keyClauses.title: Transparency Requirements
keyClauses.summary: Full public disclosure of all loan terms.

keyClauses.title: Acceleration
keyClauses.summary: Restricted to material breaches with 90-day remedy period.

keyClauses.title: Borrower Cancellation
keyClauses.summary: Borrower may cancel commitment with 30-day notice, minimal fees.

keyClauses.title: Creditor Policy Change
keyClauses.summary: Lender reserves right to suspend disbursements if borrower violates human rights.

keyClauses.title: Force Majeure
keyClauses.summary: Generous provisions allowing payment deferrals during natural disasters.

keyClauses.title: Guarantee
keyClauses.summary: Limited sovereign guarantee covers principal only.

keyClauses.title: Increased Costs
keyClauses.summary: Regulatory changes affecting lender cannot be passed to borrower.

keyClauses.title: Prepayment
keyClauses.summary: Prepayment allowed without penalty after year 5.

keyClauses.title: Cross-Default Provision
keyClauses.summary: Default on any external debt triggers acceleration.

keyClauses.title: Collateral Requirements
keyClauses.summary: Financial assets pledged with sovereign guarantees.

keyClauses.title: Contractor Selection
keyClauses.summary: No restrictions on contractor nationality.

keyClauses.title: Acceleration
keyClauses.summary: Immediate full repayment upon any covenant breach.

keyClauses.title: Confidentiality
keyClauses.summary: Financial terms confidential but loan existence may be disclosed.

keyClauses.title: Escrow Account
keyClauses.summary: 25% of all project revenue to dedicated repayment account.

keyClauses.title: Immunity Waivers
keyClauses.summary: Complete sovereign immunity waiver for all project assets.

keyClauses.title: Increased Costs
keyClauses.summary: All regulatory cost increases passed to borrower.

keyClauses.title: Lien
keyClauses.summary: First-priority lien on all project assets and equipment.

keyClauses.title: Negative Pledge
keyClauses.summary: No additional debt secured against any government assets.

keyClauses.title: Prepayment
keyClauses.summary: Prepayment allowed with 2% fee plus breakage costs.

keyClauses.title: Technical Assistance Grant
keyClauses.summary: $50M grant for capacity building and TA.

keyClauses.title: Procurement Requirements
keyClauses.summary: 30% of contracts must go to regional suppliers.

keyClauses.title: Social Impact Assessment
keyClauses.summary: Regular assessments with community participation.

keyClauses.title: Borrower Cancellation
keyClauses.summary: Cancellation possible with minimal fees and 60-day notice.

keyClauses.title: Creditor Policy Change
keyClauses.summary: Environmental or governance standard adjustments may apply to ongoing projects.

keyClauses.title: Force Majeure
keyClauses.summary: Comprehensive coverage for climate disasters with payment moratorium option.

keyClauses.title: Guarantee
keyClauses.summary: Limited sovereign guarantee with project assets as primary security.

keyClauses.title: Increased Costs
keyClauses.summary: Bank absorbs regulatory changes; borrower protected.

keyClauses.title: Prepayment
keyClauses.summary: Unlimited prepayment without penalty after year 3.

keyClauses.title: Underlying Contract
keyClauses.summary: Competitive bidding required with transparent award process.

chinaEximbank.overview: State-owned policy bank of the People's Republic of China specialising in export credit and overseas infrastructure finance.
positiveMedia: Global Infrastructure Review: 'China Eximbank drives rapid infrastructure delivery across Africa'.
Renewables Today: 'Competitive interest rates accelerate clean-energy build-out'.
negativeMedia: DebtWatch International: 'Opaque collateral triggers sovereignty concerns in multiple deals'.
Green Ledger: 'Environmental safeguards fall short of global best practice'.

president.comment: Sees alignment with rapid development agenda.

financeMinister.comment: Worried about hidden debt and revenue escrow.

parliament.comment: Opposition benches protest lack of transparency.

localCommunities.comment: Fear of limited local job creation.

parisClub.overview: Informal group of major creditor nations offering concessional terms and transparency.
positiveMedia: Finance Herald: 'Paris Club deal praised for good-governance provisions'.
SDG Monitor: 'Loan terms align with debt-sustainability frameworks'.
negativeMedia: Eurasia Weekly: 'Lengthy approval timelines frustrate borrowers'.

president.comment: Values transparency but wary of slower disbursement.

financeMinister.comment: Prefers low interest and no collateral.

infrastructureMinister.comment: Neutraltechnical standards high but paperwork heavy.

commercialBanks.overview: Syndicated loan led by international commercial banks seeking market-rate returns.
positiveMedia: Capital Markets Journal: 'Syndicate mobilises large ticket size quickly'.
negativeMedia: DebtWatch International: 'Variable rate exposes borrowers to market shocks'.
NGO Sentinel: 'Collateral clauses threaten sovereign assets'.

president.comment: Attractive for swift financing but high political risk.

financeMinister.comment: High servicing costs undermine debt strategy.

infrastructureMinister.comment: Contractor freedom beneficial but cost dynamics tense.

africanDevelopmentBank.overview: Regional multilateral development bank focusing on sustainable growth and poverty reduction.
positiveMedia: Africa Economic Review: 'AfDB blends concessional finance with TA grants'.
Climate Watch: 'Environmental and social safeguards set gold standard'.
negativeMedia: Development Times: 'Procurement preference rules criticised by foreign contractors'.

president.comment: Values developmental mandate and regional solidarity.

financeMinister.comment: Comfortable with favourable terms and grant element.

infrastructureMinister.comment: Appreciates TA and high technical standards.

localCommunities.comment: Positive due to social impact assessments.

greetings: Welcome, we value long-term partnerships with Azuria.
Let's discuss terms that secure both our interests.
Our board is eager to support your energy ambitions.
positiveFeedback: These adjustments show flexibility we can work with.
Your proposal aligns with our strategic outlook.
counterOffers: We can lower the interest to 2.7% if collateral increases to 45%.
Reducing contractor percentage below 70% would require a higher rate of 3.1%.
hardStance: Our minimum collateral threshold is non-negotiable.
Disbursement must remain immediate to meet our internal KPIs.

greetings: Thank you for considering the consortium.
Let's structure a package that favours sustainability.
positiveFeedback: Monthly environmental reporting demonstrates your commitment.
Extending grace period to 4 years is acceptable given the project's profile.
counterOffers: Interest could drop to 1.3% if grace period is limited to 2 years.
We can discuss partial guarantees in lieu of public disclosure clauses.
hardStance: Transparency remains a core requirement for all club members.
Any collateral demand would contradict our mandate  we cannot accept.

greetings: Our syndicate is ready to arrange rapid financing.
Speed and profitability guide our negotiations.
positiveFeedback: Higher escrow percentage reassures our credit committee.
counterOffers: Reducing rate to 6.0% requires shortening tenor to 13 years.
Grace period beyond 2 years adds 0.4% margin.
hardStance: Cross-default clause is standard  no exceptions.
Variable rate must reference SOFR + 375 bps minimum.

greetings: We prioritise developmental impact and regional integration.
Our technical assistance can enhance project success.
positiveFeedback: Increasing regional contractor share to 35% is well received.
Your commitment to social safeguards is commendable.
counterOffers: Interest could be 2.0% if disbursement timeline shortens to 2 years.
We propose quarterly environmental reports instead of annual.
hardStance: Grant component is fixed and cannot be expanded.
Minimum 30% regional procurement is a policy requirement.

chinaEximbank.label: Request Lower Interest
chinaEximbank.description: Ask the bank to drop the fixed rate in exchange for concessions.

chinaEximbank.label: Reduce Collateral Escrow
chinaEximbank.description: Negotiate a smaller share of revenues locked in escrow.

chinaEximbank.label: Extend Term Length
chinaEximbank.description: Push for a longer repayment horizon to ease annual debt service.

chinaEximbank.label: Limit Cross-Default
chinaEximbank.description: Restrict cross-default clause to apply only to other loans with this lender.

chinaEximbank.label: Reduce Immunity Waiver
chinaEximbank.description: Limit sovereign immunity waiver to arbitration proceedings only.

parisClub.label: Opt-in Monthly Reports
parisClub.description: Commit to more frequent environmental compliance updates.

parisClub.label: Increase Grace Period
parisClub.description: Ask for additional years before repayments start.

parisClub.label: Enhance Force Majeure
parisClub.description: Secure broader force majeure protections for climate and political events.

commercialBanks.label: Limit Lien Scope
commercialBanks.description: Restrict lien to project assets only, protecting other state assets.

commercialBanks.label: Cap Increased Costs
commercialBanks.description: Set maximum limit on regulatory cost increases that can be passed to borrower.

commercialBanks.label: Narrow Negative Pledge
commercialBanks.description: Limit negative pledge clause to cover only the project assets.

africanDevelopmentBank.label: Flexible Contract Terms
africanDevelopmentBank.description: Negotiate preference for regional contractors rather than strict requirements.

africanDevelopmentBank.label: Exempt From Policy Changes
africanDevelopmentBank.description: Secure exemption from future policy changes for this loan.

newClauses.title: Revenue-Sharing Upside
newClauses.summary: Bank receives bonus payments if project IRR exceeds 12%.

newClauses.title: Liquidity Reserve Account
newClauses.summary: Borrower sets aside 3 months of debt service during grace period.

newClauses.title: Enhanced Reporting
newClauses.summary: Monthly financial reporting to lender required.

newClauses.title: Higher Interest Rate
newClauses.summary: Interest rate increased by 0.2% to compensate for lower security.

newClauses.title: Disaster Preparedness Fund
newClauses.summary: Borrower establishes $5M fund for climate disaster preparation.

newClauses.title: Minimum Drawn Amount
newClauses.summary: At least 60% of loan must be drawn before cancellation option available.

newClauses.title: Additional Interest
newClauses.summary: Interest rate increased by 0.3% to offset reduced security.

newClauses.title: Commitment Fee Increase
newClauses.summary: Commitment fee increased by 0.15% to offset lender risk.

newClauses.title: Additional Financial Covenant
newClauses.summary: Minimum debt service coverage ratio of 1.5x required.

newClauses.title: Enhanced Environmental Monitoring
newClauses.summary: Borrower commits to enhanced environmental monitoring to offset exemption.

national.title: Sudden Budget Cut
national.description: Parliament announces a mid-year fiscal tightening that threatens to slash allocations for the dam project.

national.title: Nation-wide Labour Strike
national.description: Construction unions threaten to strike over wage disputes, jeopardising the build schedule.

regional.title: Unexpected Regional Flooding
regional.description: Early monsoon rains cause flooding in provinces downstream, raising safety concerns about continued construction.

regional.title: Competing Regional Hydropower Project
regional.description: A neighboring country announces a similar dam upstream, potentially affecting water flow and regional power prices.

international.title: Global Steel Price Spike
international.description: International commodity markets experience a sudden surge in steel prices, threatening material budgets.

international.title: International Credit Rating Downgrade
international.description: A major rating agency downgrades Azuria's sovereign bonds, increasing borrowing costs and investor scrutiny.

loanTerms.definition: A loan provision allowing the lender to demand full immediate repayment of the loan before the scheduled maturity date, typically triggered by default events.
A clause outlining the borrower's right to cancel undrawn portions of a loan, potentially subject to fees or penalties.
Assets or revenue streams pledged by the borrower to secure a loan, which can be seized by the lender in case of default.
A fee charged on the undisbursed portion of a loan, compensating the lender for keeping funds available to the borrower.
Provisions restricting disclosure of loan terms and conditions to third parties, often varying in transparency requirements.
Clauses allowing lenders to impose new conditions on existing loans when their institutional policies change, potentially affecting environmental, social, or governance requirements.
A provision triggering default on the loan if the borrower defaults on other specified debts, creating a domino effect across multiple loans.
The total amount of principal and interest a borrower must pay over a given period to satisfy loan obligations.
A measure of a borrower's ability to cover debt payments, calculated as operating income divided by total debt service.
A borrower's ability to meet current and future debt obligations without compromising economic stability or growth potential.
Total public debt as a percentage of gross domestic product, a key indicator of a country's debt burden relative to economic output.
The schedule by which loan funds are released to the borrower, often tied to project milestones or conditions.
A valuation method used to estimate the value of an investment based on its expected future cash flows, adjusted for the time value of money.
A loan repayment structure where the borrower pays the same total amount (principal plus interest) in each payment period.
A third-party account where funds are held and regulated until specified conditions are met, often used to secure loan repayments.
Contract provisions that free parties from liability when extraordinary events beyond their control prevent fulfilling obligations.
The financial risk arising from potential currency value fluctuations that can affect loan repayment costs for loans denominated in foreign currencies.
A timeframe after loan disbursement during which the borrower is not required to make principal repayments, though interest may still accrue.
A promise by a third party (guarantor) to assume debt obligation if the borrower defaults, reducing risk for the primary lender.
Legal provisions where sovereign borrowers waive their right to claim sovereign immunity in disputes, allowing lenders to pursue legal action or asset seizure.
Provisions determining which party bears the additional costs resulting from changes in law or regulations affecting the loan after signing.
The cost charged by a lender to a borrower for the use of funds, expressed as a percentage of the principal amount.
A legal right granted by the borrower to the lender to retain or seize specific assets in case of default.
The date when the final loan payment is due and the principal amount is expected to be fully repaid.
A covenant restricting the borrower from pledging assets to other creditors without providing at least equal security to the existing lender.
Repayment of all or part of a loan before its scheduled due date, sometimes subject to penalties or fees.
The original sum borrowed or face value of a loan, excluding interest or other charges.
A designated account where project revenue is deposited, often with conditions on how funds can be withdrawn and distributed.
A commitment by a national government to assume responsibility for a loan if the primary borrower defaults.
Non-financial support provided alongside financing, such as expertise, training, or consultancy to help ensure project success.
The total duration of a loan from disbursement to final repayment, including any grace period.
Provisions linking loan approval or terms to specific implementation contracts, potentially restricting contractor selection or procurement processes.
An interest rate that fluctuates over the life of a loan, typically tied to a benchmark rate such as LIBOR or SOFR.

financialInstitutions.definition: A multilateral development finance institution focused on promoting economic and social development across Africa through loans, grants, and technical assistance.
A government or government agency that provides loans directly to another country, often tied to diplomatic or commercial interests.
Export-Import Bank of China, a state-owned policy bank that provides export credits and international development finance, particularly for infrastructure projects.
Private financial institutions that provide loans at market rates with profit-oriented terms, typically requiring higher returns and stronger security than development lenders.
An international organization of 190 countries working to foster global monetary cooperation, secure financial stability, and facilitate international trade.
International financial institutions created by multiple countries to provide financing and professional advice for development projects and poverty reduction.
An informal group of official creditors whose role is to find coordinated and sustainable solutions to payment difficulties experienced by debtor countries.
A global development institution providing loans, advice, and other resources to developing countries for capital programs aimed at reducing poverty.

developmentConcepts.definition: The strategic use of development funds to mobilize private capital toward sustainable development in emerging and frontier markets.
The capacity of social, economic, and environmental systems to cope with climate-related hazards and trends while maintaining essential functions.
Loans offered on terms substantially more generous than market loans, either through below-market interest rates, longer grace periods, or a combination of both.
A situation where a country is unable to fulfill its financial obligations, or can only do so under economically or socially painful conditions.
A process that changes the terms of existing debt to make repayment more manageable, often through extending maturities or reducing interest rates.
A framework used by international financial institutions to analyze a country's current and future debt situation to assess risk of debt distress.
A process of evaluating the likely environmental and social impacts of a proposed project, including both positive and negative consequences.
A set of standards for a company or project's operations used by socially conscious investors and lenders to screen potential investments.
The difference between a loan's face value and the sum of discounted future debt-service payments, expressed as a percentage of the face value.
Borrowing that is not transparently reported or fully disclosed in official government accounts, creating financial vulnerabilities.
Provisions requiring a certain percentage of goods, services, or labor to be sourced locally, aimed at ensuring domestic economic benefits.
The process of selecting contractors, suppliers, and service providers for a development project, subject to various rules depending on the lender.
A cooperative arrangement between public and private sectors, combining government oversight with private sector efficiency and capital.
Financing secured by future revenue from natural resources like oil, minerals, or agricultural commodities, often used in resource-rich developing countries.
A performance measure used to evaluate the efficiency of an investment, calculated by dividing net profit by the cost of the investment.
The risk that a government may default on its debt obligations or introduce policies reducing investment value, affecting all economic activities within its jurisdiction.
A collection of 17 global goals set by the United Nations General Assembly in 2015, designed to be a blueprint for achieving a better and more sustainable future.
The combined assessment of whether a project is technically feasible and economically profitable, a fundamental consideration for project financing.

legalAndFinancialProcesses.definition: A procedure where a dispute is submitted to one or more impartial arbitrators who make a binding decision, often specified in international loan agreements as an alternative to court proceedings.
Prerequisites that must be satisfied before a loan agreement becomes effective or before funds are disbursed.
Adherence to environmental laws, regulations, and standards required by lenders as part of loan conditions.
The process of involving multiple lenders in financing a single borrower, often used for large projects to distribute risk.
A significant negative change in circumstances that could affect a borrower's ability to fulfill its obligations under a loan agreement.
Strategies and instruments used to reduce exposure to various risks in development finance, including political risk insurance and currency hedging.
An assessment of a national government's creditworthiness, issued by credit rating agencies and influencing borrowing costs.
Open and fair processes for purchasing goods, works, and services for development projects, intended to promote competition and prevent corruption.

analysisToFunding.description: To advance from Analysis to Funding phase, players must achieve an average stakeholder satisfaction of at least 45%, with no fewer than 4 stakeholders above the low satisfaction threshold. Players must also score at least 60% on the quiz and spend a minimum of 15 minutes in the Analysis phase.

fundingToNegotiation.description: To advance from Funding to Negotiation phase, players must review all key documents, select a preferred lender, and consult with at least one key stakeholder about the funding choice.

negotiationToCompletion.description: To complete the Negotiation phase and finalize the project, players must secure accepted loan terms, maintain an average stakeholder satisfaction of at least 55%, and review all loan clauses.

primary: Pass the assessment quiz with at least 60% correct answers
Engage with all six stakeholders at least once
secondary: Identify at least 3 critical project risks
Present economic impact analysis to parliament
Establish positive relationship with at least 4 stakeholders

primary: Select a lender with at least two high-level stakeholder approvals
secondary: Consult finance minister about debt-to-GDP implications
Review at least 3 previous similar projects

primary: Secure loan terms with interest rate below initial offer
Negotiate at least one improved clause condition
secondary: Reduce collateral requirements by at least 5%
Secure improved local contractor participation terms
Negotiate longer grace period than initial offer

outcomes: Project becomes regional exemplar for sustainable infrastructure
Debt-to-GDP ratio rises initially but stabilizes within 3 years
Local communities see significant economic improvements
President Makena's approval rating increases by 15%
Project completes on schedule with full loan disbursement
Project provides necessary power capacity with acceptable costs
Debt service remains within fiscal constraints with careful management
Environmental coalitions acknowledge sufficient protections
Local employment meets minimum targets with adequate compensation
Project experiences minor delays but achieves core objectives

trigger.condition: Any two primary stakeholders below 20% satisfaction
trigger.description: Critical stakeholder opposition blocks project advancement

outcomes: Cabinet withdraws support for the project amid political backlash
International reputation suffers among development partners
Energy crisis worsens, leading to increased load shedding
Alternative project pursued with 18-month delay and 30% higher costs
Player's role as development advisor is terminated

trigger.condition: Debt-to-GDP ratio exceeds 75% or debt service above 25% of revenue
trigger.description: Project financing terms create unsustainable debt burden

outcomes: IMF issues formal warning about debt distress risk
Sovereign credit rating downgraded by two notches
Government forced to implement austerity measures
Project restructured with reduced scope and capacity
Finance Minister resigns amid fiscal sustainability concerns

trigger.condition: Environmental compliance score below 30% or rejection by environmental coalition
trigger.description: Insufficient environmental safeguards lead to ecological damage

outcomes: Significant habitat destruction triggers international criticism
Legal challenges halt construction for environmental review
Project costs increase 40% to address remediation requirements
Multilateral funding sources withdraw support
Widespread protests damage government credibility

steps.title: Understanding Your Role
steps.content: You are an international development consultant advising on the Kani River Hydroelectric Project in Azuria.

steps.title: Game Phases
steps.content: The simulation consists of three phases: Analysis, Funding, and Negotiation. Each phase has specific objectives.

steps.title: Stakeholder Management
steps.content: Your success depends on balancing the needs and expectations of six key stakeholders.

steps.title: Resources
steps.content: You have limited time, staff, and political capital. Allocate them wisely.

steps.title: Decision Making
steps.content: Your choices will affect project outcomes, stakeholder satisfaction, and financial sustainability.

steps.title: Stakeholder Engagement
steps.content: Meet with each stakeholder to understand their priorities and concerns.

steps.title: Project Assessment
steps.content: Review project details, environmental impacts, and social considerations.

steps.title: Country Context
steps.content: Understand Azuria's economic situation and development challenges.

steps.title: Knowledge Assessment
steps.content: Complete the quiz to demonstrate your understanding of key concepts.

steps.title: Compare Lenders
steps.content: Review terms offered by different potential financiers.

steps.title: Risk Assessment
steps.content: Evaluate financial risks associated with each funding option.

steps.title: Stakeholder Consultation
steps.content: Discuss financing options with key stakeholders before making your selection.

steps.title: Understanding Loan Terms
steps.content: Review the detailed terms offered by your chosen lender.

steps.title: Negotiation Strategy
steps.content: Select which terms to negotiate based on stakeholder priorities and financial sustainability.

steps.title: Evaluating Counteroffers
steps.content: Assess the implications of lender responses to your negotiation efforts.

conceptExplanations.shortDefinition: A country's ability to meet debt obligations without compromising growth
conceptExplanations.detailedExplanation: Debt sustainability refers to a country's ability to meet current and future debt service obligations without requiring debt relief, restructuring, or accumulating arrears, while maintaining an acceptable level of economic growth.

conceptExplanations.shortDefinition: Government's pledge to assume loan responsibility if project defaults
conceptExplanations.detailedExplanation: A sovereign guarantee is a promise by a national government to assume responsibility for the payment of a loan in the event that the borrower fails to do so. This significantly reduces risk for lenders but increases the government's contingent liabilities.

conceptExplanations.shortDefinition: Default on one loan triggers default on others
conceptExplanations.detailedExplanation: A cross-default provision in a loan agreement means that if the borrower defaults on another specified loan or obligation, it automatically constitutes a default under this agreement as well, even if payments on this particular loan are current.

conceptExplanations.shortDefinition: Evaluation of a project's consequences for nature and communities
conceptExplanations.detailedExplanation: An ESIA is a process of evaluating the likely environmental and social impacts of a proposed project or development, taking into account inter-related socio-economic, cultural and human-health impacts, both beneficial and adverse.

loanTermAnalysis.title: Understanding Loan Terms
steps: Examine the interest rate compared to market benchmarks
Consider the grace period in relation to project construction timeline
Evaluate collateral requirements against national assets
Assess implications of legal clauses like cross-default and acceleration

stakeholderMapping.title: Mapping Stakeholder Interests
steps: Note potential conflicts between stakeholder priorities
Assess relative power and influence of each stakeholder
Develop engagement strategy based on stakeholder mapping

positive.message: Excellent! Your approach resonated strongly with {stakeholder}.

neutral.message: {stakeholder} acknowledges your points but remains cautious.
More preparation might have strengthened your position with {stakeholder}.
You addressed some but not all of {stakeholder}'s concerns.

negative.message: Your approach did not align with {stakeholder}'s expectations.
Lack of preparation undermined your credibility with {stakeholder}.

positive.message: This interest rate is favorable compared to market benchmarks.
The grace period adequately covers the construction timeline.
The absence of collateral requirements is highly advantageous.

neutral.message: This interest rate is in line with current market conditions.
The grace period is shorter than ideal but workable.
Collateral requirements are standard for this type of financing.

negative.message: This interest rate is significantly above market benchmarks.
The extensive collateral requirements pose sovereignty concerns.
These loan covenants severely restrict policy flexibility.

positive.message: The lender has made a surprisingly generous counteroffer.
You've successfully negotiated improvements on multiple terms.
Your strategic concession has yielded important gains on key terms.

neutral.message: The lender has offered modest improvements to the original terms.
This counteroffer represents a balanced compromise.
The lender accepted some but not all of your proposed changes.

negative.message: The lender has responded with more stringent terms than before.
Your attempt to negotiate critical terms has been firmly rejected.
The lender has adopted a hard stance and appears unwilling to compromise.

stakeholderEngagement.hint: Consider each stakeholder's role and institutional priorities before meeting with them.
Review the extended stakeholder information to understand their specific concerns about the project.
Allocate additional staff to research stakeholder positions before important meetings.
The Finance Minister is particularly concerned about debt sustainability, while the Infrastructure Minister focuses on technical feasibility.

lenderSelection.hint: Compare interest rates, grace periods, and maturity across all lenders.
Look beyond the headline financial terms to understand the conditions and clauses attached to each offer.
Consider how each lender's requirements will affect different stakeholders' satisfaction.
China Eximbank offers quick disbursement but has strict contractor requirements; the African Development Bank includes valuable technical assistance but has a slower disbursement timeline.

negotiationStrategy.hint: Prioritize negotiating the terms that most directly affect project viability and stakeholder concerns.
Some terms may be less negotiable than others; focus your efforts on areas where the lender has indicated flexibility.
Consider trading concessions in less critical areas to gain improvements in high-priority terms.
The Commercial Banks are most flexible on contractor requirements but rigid on financial terms; Paris Club is open to environmental reporting changes in exchange for financial concessions.

situationalPrompts.message: Several stakeholders seem dissatisfied. Consider reviewing their priorities and engaging with them more effectively.
These loan terms may create debt sustainability concerns. Consider consulting the Finance Minister.
You haven't thoroughly addressed environmental concerns, which could lead to complications later.
Your staff allocation seems inefficient. Consider redistributing resources to higher priority activities.

overallScore.description: Overall performance score weighted based on stakeholder management, financial outcomes, and project sustainability.

stakeholderScore.description: Measurement of stakeholder relationship management with emphasis on key decision-makers.

financialScore.description: Evaluation of financial outcomes including debt impacts and negotiation effectiveness.

sustainabilityScore.description: Assessment of long-term project impacts on environment, society, and development goals.

lowestStakeholderSatisfaction.calculation: Satisfaction level of least satisfied stakeholder

stakeholderConflictManagement.calculation: Degree to which competing stakeholder interests were balanced

interestRateAchievement.calculation: Interest rate secured vs. market benchmark

debtSustainabilityImpact.calculation: Projected change in debt-to-GDP ratio over 5 years

financingFlexibility.calculation: Degree of restrictive covenants in final agreement

environmentalSafeguards.calculation: Strength of environmental protections in final agreement

stakeholderSatisfaction.description: Average stakeholder satisfaction at simulation conclusion

negotiatedInterestRate.expert: Below initial offer by 0.5% or more
negotiatedInterestRate.novice: At or slightly below initial offer
negotiatedInterestRate.description: Final interest rate compared to initial lender offer

environmentalProtections.description: Environmental provisions in final loan agreement

localContentAchievement.description: Percentage of project work allocated to local contractors

timeSpentOnAnalysis.description: Time allocated to analyzing project and stakeholder needs

exemplary.title: Development Finance Exemplar
exemplary.description: Your approach to the Kani River project demonstrated exceptional balance between financial sustainability, stakeholder interests, and development impact. The negotiated agreement sets a new standard for infrastructure financing in the region.

successful.title: Effective Development Partner
successful.description: You successfully balanced competing priorities to secure favorable financing for the Kani River project. The agreement offers solid terms while addressing key stakeholder concerns and maintaining reasonable environmental protections.

adequate.title: Competent Project Advisor
adequate.description: You managed to advance the Kani River project with acceptable financing terms. While some stakeholders have reservations and certain terms could have been improved, the project remains viable and will deliver needed energy capacity.

problematic.title: Challenging Implementation Ahead
problematic.description: The financing secured for the Kani River project presents significant challenges. Stakeholder dissatisfaction, suboptimal financial terms, or sustainability concerns will complicate project implementation and potentially limit development benefits.

learningObjectives.objective: Understand key loan terms and clauses in development finance
learningObjectives.assessmentMethod: Correctly identifying implications of loan provisions during negotiation
learningObjectives.excellentCriteria: Negotiated improvements to at least 3 key loan clauses
learningObjectives.evidenceTracking: Negotiation choices and decisions regarding loan terms

learningObjectives.objective: Balance competing stakeholder interests in infrastructure projects
learningObjectives.assessmentMethod: Maintain acceptable satisfaction across diverse stakeholders
learningObjectives.excellentCriteria: No stakeholder below 50% satisfaction and at least 3 above 70%
learningObjectives.evidenceTracking: Stakeholder engagement choices and resulting satisfaction changes

learningObjectives.objective: Evaluate debt sustainability implications of major projects
learningObjectives.assessmentMethod: Consider debt indicators when selecting and negotiating financing
learningObjectives.excellentCriteria: Selected financing that maintains or improves debt sustainability indicators
learningObjectives.evidenceTracking: Review of financial indicators and lender selection rationale

learningObjectives.objective: Recognize hidden costs and risks in financing agreements
learningObjectives.assessmentMethod: Identify problematic clauses and negotiate improvements
learningObjectives.excellentCriteria: Identified and addressed at least 4 high-risk clauses during negotiation
learningObjectives.evidenceTracking: Clause analysis and negotiation focus areas

learningObjectives.objective: Consider long-term environmental and social impacts
learningObjectives.assessmentMethod: Include environmental and social factors in decision-making
learningObjectives.excellentCriteria: Secured enhanced environmental reporting and social benefit provisions
learningObjectives.evidenceTracking: Engagement with environmental coalition and negotiation of safeguards

analysisState.dialogChoices: object mapping dialog ids to chosen options

playerDecisions.keydecisions: array of decision objects with timestamps
playerDecisions.resourceAllocation: array of allocation events with timestamps

automaticCheckpoints.description: Save automatically when player completes a game phase
Save when stakeholder satisfaction changes by more than 15 points
Save after significant decisions like lender selection or final term acceptance
Save every 10 minutes of active gameplay

completedGames.finalStakeholderSatisfaction: object mapping stakeholder ids to satisfaction values

achievements.name: Master Negotiator
achievements.description: Improve at least 4 loan terms from the initial offer

achievements.name: Stakeholder Whisperer
achievements.description: Achieve at least 70% satisfaction with all stakeholders

achievements.name: Debt Sustainability Champion
achievements.description: Secure financing that improves long-term debt-to-GDP ratio

achievements.name: Environmental Guardian
achievements.description: Secure enhanced environmental protections beyond standard requirements

statisticsTracking.timeSpentByPhase: object mapping phase ids to minutes
statisticsTracking.stakeholderInteractions: object mapping stakeholder ids to interaction count
statisticsTracking.negotiationAttempts: object mapping term ids to negotiation attempt count
statisticsTracking.resourceUsage: object tracking resource allocation by category

unlockableFunctionality.name: Advanced Negotiation Options
unlockableFunctionality.requirements: Complete game once with 'Successful' outcome or better

unlockableFunctionality.name: Expert Difficulty Level
unlockableFunctionality.requirements: Complete game on Professional difficulty with 'Exemplary' outcome

unlockableFunctionality.name: Comparative Analysis Tools
unlockableFunctionality.requirements: Complete the game with at least 3 different lenders

scenes.caption: The Republic of Azuria faces growing energy demands.
The Kani River offers potential for renewable energy development.
As a development consultant, you must help secure sustainable financing.
Construction begins on the Kani River Dam.
The project advances, bringing opportunities to local communities.
Your financial strategy shapes Azuria's development for generations to come.

beginner.name: Beginner
beginner.description: Designed for those new to development finance concepts, with detailed guidance and more forgiving conditions.

professional.name: Professional
professional.description: Standard difficulty that reflects realistic challenges in development project financing.

expert.name: Expert
expert.description: Challenging scenario with limited resources and demanding stakeholders, designed for experienced players.

stakeholderSatisfaction.description: If average stakeholder satisfaction falls below 40%, slightly increase future satisfaction gains.

resourceDepletion.description: If time resource falls below 10, provide a small bonus to prevent frustrating game-ending scenarios.

negotiationStruggle.description: If multiple negotiation offers are rejected consecutively, slightly increase lender flexibility.

options.name: Economic Boom
options.effect: Lenders offer more favorable terms; debt sustainability less concerning

options.name: Stable Economy
options.effect: Standard economic conditions with balanced lending environment

options.name: Economic Downturn
options.effect: Lenders more cautious; financing terms less favorable

options.name: Standard Politics
options.effect: Typical mix of aligned and competing stakeholder interests

options.name: Competing Agendas
options.effect: Difficult to satisfy multiple stakeholders simultaneously

options.name: Straightforward Project
options.effect: Fewer complications and stakeholder concerns to address

options.name: Highly Complex Project
options.effect: More environmental, social, and technical challenges to navigate

analysisPhase.description: Which stakeholders the player focused on engaging with first
analysisPhase.significance: Reveals player's initial strategy and understanding of power dynamics
Indicates priority placed on environmental vs economic considerations

analysisPhase.description: Player's score on the assessment quiz
analysisPhase.significance: Measures understanding of core development finance concepts

fundingPhase.description: Which lender the player ultimately selected
fundingPhase.significance: Reveals fundamental financing strategy and priorities

fundingPhase.description: Which stakeholders were consulted about financing options
fundingPhase.significance: Shows player's approach to building consensus and gathering input

fundingPhase.description: How thoroughly player assessed financial indicators and risks
fundingPhase.significance: Indicates level of due diligence and risk awareness

negotiationPhase.description: Which loan terms the player prioritized for improvement
negotiationPhase.significance: Reveals understanding of term importance and negotiation strategy

negotiationPhase.description: How effectively player identified problematic clauses
negotiationPhase.significance: Measures attention to detail and awareness of hidden debt risks

negotiationPhase.description: Areas where player ultimately made concessions
negotiationPhase.significance: Shows player's final priorities when forced to make trade-offs

timeSpentPerPhase.description: Distribution of time resource across game phases

staffAllocationPatterns.description: How staff were allocated to different activities

phaseCompletionTime.description: Time taken to complete each game phase

timeSpentOnInformation.description: Time spent reviewing documents, data, and stakeholder information
timeSpentOnInformation.significance: Shows player's research habits and information gathering approach

timeSpentOnInteraction.description: Time spent in stakeholder dialogs and negotiations
timeSpentOnInteraction.significance: Indicates interpersonal engagement and communication strategy

decisionSpeed.description: Average time taken for key decisions
decisionSpeed.significance: Reflects decisiveness and confidence in knowledge application

coreObjectives.description: Understanding debt sustainability implications of financing choices
coreObjectives.assessmentMethod: Analysis of player's consideration of debt indicators when selecting and negotiating financing
coreObjectives.evidenceTracking: Review of financial indicators, lender selection rationale, and term negotiations

competencyLevels.expert: Selected financing that improves debt sustainability indicators and negotiated better terms on high-risk clauses
competencyLevels.proficient: Selected financing with manageable debt implications and addressed major risk clauses
competencyLevels.basic: Considered some debt implications but missed key risk factors
competencyLevels.undeveloped: Made financing choices without adequate consideration of debt sustainability

coreObjectives.description: Balancing competing stakeholder interests in infrastructure projects
coreObjectives.assessmentMethod: Measurement of stakeholder satisfaction distribution at game conclusion
coreObjectives.evidenceTracking: Stakeholder engagement choices, satisfaction metrics, and conflict resolution approaches

competencyLevels.expert: Maintained high satisfaction across diverse stakeholders with competing interests
competencyLevels.proficient: Balanced main stakeholder interests with acceptable satisfaction levels
competencyLevels.basic: Satisfied some key stakeholders but created significant dissatisfaction in others
competencyLevels.undeveloped: Failed to maintain adequate satisfaction across required stakeholders

coreObjectives.description: Recognizing implicit sovereign obligations in financing agreements
coreObjectives.assessmentMethod: Identification and negotiation of problematic loan clauses
coreObjectives.evidenceTracking: Clause analysis, negotiation focus areas, and final agreement terms

competencyLevels.expert: Identified and successfully negotiated improvements to most high-risk clauses
competencyLevels.proficient: Recognized major risk clauses and improved some key terms
competencyLevels.basic: Identified some problematic clauses but failed to negotiate improvements
competencyLevels.undeveloped: Missed most high-risk clauses and their implications

coreObjectives.description: Evaluating long-term development impacts of infrastructure financing
coreObjectives.assessmentMethod: Consideration of environmental, social, and economic factors in decisions
coreObjectives.evidenceTracking: Environmental and social protection negotiations, local content provisions

competencyLevels.expert: Secured financing that balances economic growth with strong environmental and social protections
competencyLevels.proficient: Maintained adequate environmental and social standards while achieving economic goals
competencyLevels.basic: Prioritized economic outcomes with minimal environmental and social considerations
competencyLevels.undeveloped: Focused exclusively on financing terms without considering broader impacts

conceptMastery.trackingMethod: Evidence of concept application in gameplay decisions

conceptAreas.description: Implications of explicit and implicit government guarantees
Understanding revenue escrow impacts on fiscal flexibility
Knowledge of environmental standards and monitoring requirements
Balancing local development benefits with project efficiency

events.title: Cabinet Reshuffle
events.description: President Makena has reorganized her cabinet, appointing new ministers.

effects.narrative: The appointment of a new Finance Minister with infrastructure development experience has shifted government priorities.
effects.mediaCoverage: Azuria Economic Times reports cabinet changes signal renewed focus on infrastructure development.

events.title: Regional Drought Alert
events.description: Meteorological forecasts predict below-average rainfall for the next 18 months.

effects.narrative: Drought concerns have raised questions about the reliability of hydroelectric generation forecasts.

playerChoices.text: Add drought mitigation to project scope

events.title: Global Interest Rates Rise
events.description: Major central banks have increased interest rates to combat inflation.

effects.narrative: The global rate hikes have significantly altered your financing landscape just as negotiations begin.

events.title: Opposition Scrutiny Campaign
events.description: The parliamentary opposition has launched a public campaign questioning project financing.

mediaEvent.title: Parliamentary Debate on Kani Dam Financing

effects.narrative: The opposition claims the project will place Azuria in a 'debt trap' with foreign lenders.

playerChoices.text: Invite opposition leaders to project briefing

events.title: Construction Material Price Surge
events.description: Global supply chain disruptions have caused a spike in key construction material prices.

effects.narrative: Your project now requires significantly more financing than initially projected.

events.title: Challenging Geological Conditions
events.description: Advanced surveys reveal more complex geological conditions at the dam site than anticipated.

effects.narrative: The geological challenges will require specialized engineering solutions and extended timelines.

beginner.name: Development Advisor
beginner.description: Learn the fundamentals of development finance with more forgiving stakeholders and favorable terms.

intermediate.name: Project Manager
intermediate.description: Standard simulation conditions closely matching real-world development finance challenges.

advanced.name: Finance Minister
advanced.description: Navigate a complex financial landscape with demanding stakeholders and challenging loan terms.

expert.name: National Leader
expert.description: Master the ultimate challenge with volatile conditions, demanding stakeholders, and unpredictable events.

values.name: Supportive
values.description: Stakeholders are more easily satisfied with your decisions.

values.name: Realistic
values.description: Stakeholders have balanced expectations about project outcomes.

values.name: Demanding
values.description: Stakeholders have high expectations and are difficult to please.

values.name: Prosperous
values.description: Strong economic fundamentals provide a stable foundation.

values.name: Moderate
values.description: Standard economic conditions with typical volatility.

values.name: Challenging
values.description: Difficult economic environment with fiscal constraints.

values.name: Generous
values.description: Lenders offer more favorable terms and flexibility.

values.name: Standard
values.description: Typical lending practices based on market conditions.

values.name: Stringent
values.description: Lenders impose stricter terms and limited negotiation space.

values.name: Infrequent
values.description: Fewer unexpected events disrupt your plans.

negotiation.name: Master Negotiator
negotiation.description: Improve at least three loan terms by 20% or more in a single negotiation.

negotiation.name: Interest Rate Champion
negotiation.description: Secure an interest rate at least 1.5% lower than the initial offer.
negotiation.rewardDescription: Unlocks interest rate sensitivity analysis tool.

negotiation.name: Balanced Deal
negotiation.description: Complete a negotiation with all stakeholder satisfaction above 60%.
negotiation.rewardDescription: Unlocks special stakeholder insights in future games.

stakeholderManagement.name: Political Mastermind
stakeholderManagement.description: Maintain President and Parliament satisfaction above 75% throughout the entire project.

stakeholderManagement.name: Community Champion
stakeholderManagement.description: Raise Local Communities satisfaction from below 40% to above 70%.

economicManagement.name: Fiscal Prudence
economicManagement.description: Complete the project without increasing the debt-to-GDP ratio by more than 3 percentage points.

economicManagement.name: Sustainable Financing
economicManagement.description: Maintain all debt sustainability indicators in the 'green' zone throughout the project.
economicManagement.rewardDescription: Unlocks sustainability certification for your profile.

projectVariety.name: Diversified Portfolio
projectVariety.description: Complete the game with each of the three different project types.

projectVariety.name: Lender Explorer
projectVariety.description: Successfully complete projects with all four different lenders.

mastery.name: Expert Completion
mastery.description: Successfully complete the project on Expert difficulty.
mastery.rewardDescription: Unlocks 'National Leader' title and special game options.

mastery.name: Perfect Project
mastery.description: Complete the project with all outcome metrics in the 'excellent' range.
mastery.rewardDescription: Unlocks special ending and custom difficulty options.

satisfactory.description: Acceptable performance with notable room for improvement.

debtSustainability.formula: weighted average of debt indicator deltas from baseline

energyAccess.formula: percentage increase in national electrification weighted by rural/urban distribution

scenarios.name: Improved Interest Rate
scenarios.description: If you had secured a 1% lower interest rate

scenarios.name: Extended Grace Period
scenarios.description: If you had negotiated a 2-year longer grace period

scenarios.name: Higher Quality Contractors
scenarios.description: If you had selected premium contractors at 15% higher cost

scenarios.name: Alternative Project Type
scenarios.description: If you had selected a different energy project type

excellent.title: Legacy Secured
excellent.narrative: President Makena's vision of energy independence became a cornerstone of her legacy. The successful Kani River Project catalyzed further infrastructure development, and she secured a comfortable re-election with energy self-sufficiency as her administration's hallmark achievement.

good.title: Political Capital Secured
good.narrative: While facing some criticism over certain aspects of the Kani River Project, President Makena successfully leveraged the overall positive outcomes to strengthen her position. The project's contribution to national development featured prominently in her policy achievements.

poor.title: Political Challenges
poor.narrative: The troubled implementation of the Kani River Project became a political liability for President Makena. Opposition parties used the project's shortcomings to question her leadership, forcing her to distance herself from the project and focus on other achievements.

failed.title: Political Fallout
failed.narrative: The Kani River Project's failure became emblematic of broader governance issues. President Makena faced a serious challenge in the subsequent election, with the opposition campaign centered around the project's mismanagement and financial burden.

excellent.title: Financial Acumen Validated
excellent.narrative: Finance Minister Odili received international recognition for the prudent financing structure of the Kani River Project. The sustainable debt management approach became a case study at the IMF, enhancing both his reputation and Azuria's standing in international financial markets.

good.title: Fiscal Management Success
good.narrative: Despite some initial concerns, Minister Odili's oversight of the Kani River Project's financing demonstrated sound fiscal management. The project's financial performance largely aligned with projections, helping maintain Azuria's credit rating.

poor.title: Budget Strain
poor.narrative: Minister Odili faced ongoing challenges integrating the higher-than-expected costs of the Kani River Project into national budgets. The strain on fiscal resources required painful adjustments in other areas, drawing criticism from both the public and parliament.

failed.title: Financial Crisis Management
failed.narrative: The Kani River Project's financial structure proved unsustainable, forcing Minister Odili into crisis management. Debt restructuring negotiations and emergency fiscal measures became necessary, damaging his reputation and Azuria's financial standing.

excellent.title: Ahead of Schedule, Under Budget
excellent.narrative: The Kani River Project's construction proceeded smoothly, with efficient contractor management and favorable conditions allowing completion 6 months ahead of schedule and 5% under budget. Advanced engineering techniques minimized environmental disruption during the dam construction.

good.title: On Track Implementation
good.narrative: Construction of the Kani River Project proceeded largely according to plan. Some minor delays were encountered during the foundation phase, but contingency planning allowed the project to remain within 3% of budget and timeline targets.

poor.title: Implementation Challenges
poor.narrative: The construction phase faced significant hurdles, including seasonal flooding and contractor disputes that delayed progress by 14 months. Cost overruns reached 18%, requiring additional financing and straining relationships with lenders.

failed.title: Construction Crisis
failed.narrative: Multiple critical issues plagued construction, including major geological challenges, contractor bankruptcy, and severe weather events. The project fell 30 months behind schedule with 40% cost overruns, triggering default clauses with lenders.

excellent.year1: Initial operations exceeded expectations, with 50% capacity achieved 3 months ahead of schedule and reliability metrics surpassing design specifications.
excellent.year3: Full capacity reached with 108% of projected energy output due to favorable rainfall patterns and operational efficiencies.
excellent.year5: The project has become a regional benchmark for hydroelectric operations, with international delegations studying its success.
excellent.year10: Operational excellence has allowed revenue to exceed projections by 15%, enabling accelerated debt repayment.
excellent.year20: The facility continues to perform above specifications with minimal degradation, positioning for an extended operational lifespan.

good.year1: Operations began on schedule, with normal commissioning challenges resolved efficiently to reach 45% of capacity.
good.year3: Full capacity achieved with output matching 97% of projections and standard operational parameters.
good.year5: The project operates reliably with routine maintenance keeping all systems within optimal parameters.
good.year10: Consistent performance has generated revenue in line with financial projections, meeting debt service requirements comfortably.
good.year20: The facility shows normal wear but remains fully operational with standard maintenance protocols.

poor.year1: Technical issues delayed initial operations by 7 months, with capacity limited to 30% during troubleshooting.
poor.year3: Ongoing turbine efficiency problems limited output to 80% of projections, affecting revenue generation.
poor.year5: Higher than anticipated maintenance costs and periodic shutdowns have strained the operational budget.
poor.year10: Performance inconsistency has resulted in revenue 20% below projections, creating debt service pressure.
poor.year20: Accelerated degradation of key systems has reduced reliability and output, requiring major refurbishment.

failed.year1: Critical design flaws prevented operation beyond 20% capacity, with extensive remediation required.
failed.year3: Multiple system failures have limited reliable operation, with output at only 55% of projections.
failed.year5: Structural concerns have forced operational restrictions, with safety systems frequently triggered.
failed.year10: The facility operates intermittently, generating insufficient revenue to cover debt service, requiring government subsidy.
failed.year20: Technical obsolescence and accumulated damage have rendered the facility economically and technically unsustainable.

excellent.year5: The reliable and affordable electricity from the Kani River Project has stimulated industrial development, contributing 0.8% directly to GDP growth.
excellent.year10: Expanded manufacturing capacity enabled by consistent energy supply has increased exports by 12% and contributed 1.2% to GDP growth.

good.year5: Energy availability has supported moderate industrial expansion, contributing 0.5% to GDP growth.
good.year10: Improved energy reliability has supported export growth of 7% and contributed 0.8% to GDP growth.

poor.year5: Inconsistent energy supply has limited industrial expansion, contributing only 0.2% to GDP growth.
poor.year10: Persistent energy reliability issues have constrained economic development, with negligible contribution to export growth.

failed.year5: The project's underperformance has created an energy deficit, actually constraining GDP growth by 0.3%.
failed.year10: Ongoing energy shortages have forced reliance on expensive imports, creating a drag on economic performance and exports.

scenarios.excellent: Strong project performance enabled early debt repayment, freeing fiscal resources for other development priorities. The government's debt-to-GDP ratio decreased by 3 percentage points by year 10.
scenarios.good: The project's financial performance aligned with projections, with debt service requirements managed within fiscal constraints. The debt-to-GDP ratio stabilized by year 7.
scenarios.poor: Higher than projected debt service requirements strained the national budget, limiting fiscal space for other priorities and contributing to a 2 percentage point increase in the debt-to-GDP ratio.
scenarios.failed: Unsustainable debt service requirements forced debt restructuring, damaging sovereign credit ratings and raising borrowing costs across all government activities.

negotiationInsights.title: Interest Rate Impact
negotiationInsights.description: Each 0.5% reduction in interest rate saved approximately $X million over the loan term, highlighting the importance of prioritizing this term in negotiations.
negotiationInsights.applicationNote: Future infrastructure projects should consider employing financial advisors with specific experience in multilateral development bank negotiations.

negotiationInsights.title: Collateral Requirements
negotiationInsights.description: Revenue escrow requirements significantly impacted fiscal flexibility during project implementation.
negotiationInsights.applicationNote: Understanding the operational implications of collateral structures is as important as their direct financial cost.

negotiationInsights.title: Stakeholder Alignment
negotiationInsights.description: Pre-negotiation alignment among key government stakeholders improved bargaining position with lenders.
negotiationInsights.applicationNote: Formal internal consensus-building mechanisms should be established before external negotiations begin.

implementationLessons.title: Contractor Selection
implementationLessons.description: The balance between cost and expertise in contractor selection had long-term implications for project quality and timeline adherence.
implementationLessons.applicationNote: Comprehensive contractor evaluation frameworks with weighted technical criteria yield better overall outcomes than lowest-bid approaches.

implementationLessons.title: Environmental Planning
implementationLessons.description: Early integration of environmental mitigation measures reduced implementation delays from regulatory and community challenges.
implementationLessons.applicationNote: Environmental considerations should be core project components rather than compliance afterthoughts.

implementationLessons.title: Adaptive Management
implementationLessons.description: Establishing clear protocols for addressing unexpected challenges improved resilience during implementation.
implementationLessons.applicationNote: Formal contingency planning and decision frameworks provide valuable structure during crisis situations.

strategicTakeaways.title: Development Finance Landscape
strategicTakeaways.description: Lender diversity creates negotiating leverage but increases coordination complexity.
strategicTakeaways.applicationNote: A strategic approach to development finance should balance term optimization against transaction and management costs.

strategicTakeaways.title: Infrastructure as Development Catalyst
strategicTakeaways.description: Energy infrastructure provides maximum economic benefit when integrated with broader industrial and social development planning.
strategicTakeaways.applicationNote: Complementary policies and investments should be synchronized with infrastructure development timelines.

strategicTakeaways.title: Sovereignty Considerations
strategicTakeaways.description: Financing terms have long-term implications for economic sovereignty and policy flexibility.
strategicTakeaways.applicationNote: Financing evaluation frameworks should explicitly include sovereignty and policy space metrics alongside traditional financial indicators.

triggers.yellow: Any one indicator exceeds low-income threshold
triggers.orange: Any two indicators exceed low-income threshold
triggers.red: Any indicator exceeds middle-income threshold OR three indicators exceed low-income threshold
triggers.black: Multiple indicators exceed middle-income threshold OR debt-service to revenue exceeds 25%

warningMessages.yellow: Early signs of potential debt stress. Consider fiscal consolidation and limiting non-concessional borrowing.
warningMessages.orange: Moderate debt vulnerability. Review new financing carefully and prioritize concessional terms.
warningMessages.red: High debt vulnerability. Urgent review of borrowing plans required. Consider debt restructuring options.
warningMessages.black: Severe debt distress likely. Immediate action required to prevent default.

baseScenario.name: Baseline
baseScenario.description: Expected economic trajectory based on current trends and moderate project success

alternativeScenarios.name: Global Commodity Price Shock
alternativeScenarios.description: Major decline in global commodity prices affecting export revenues and currency stability

alternativeScenarios.name: Regional Drought Crisis
alternativeScenarios.description: Severe drought affecting hydroelectric output, agricultural production, and forcing emergency imports

alternativeScenarios.name: Regional Political Instability
alternativeScenarios.description: Political turmoil in neighboring countries affecting trade, investment, and security costs

interestRateImpact.description: Effect of negotiated interest rate on debt service and sustainability

sensitivity.baseFormulaText: For each 0.5% reduction in interest rate, debt service decreases by approximately $X million over the loan term

parliament.highImpact: Interest rate below similar project average

gracePeriodImpact.description: Effect of grace period on fiscal space during construction and early operations
gracePeriodImpact.fiscalSpaceCreated: calculated based on grace period length and loan amount

president.highImpact: Grace period covers construction plus 1 year

infrastructureMinister.highImpact: Grace period covers full construction phase

collateralRequirementsImpact.description: Long-term effect of asset/revenue collateral on sovereign control

revenueCollateralPercentage.description: Percentage reduction in fiscal flexibility based on revenue collateralization

contractorRequirementsImpact.description: Effect of tied procurement on costs, quality, and local economic benefits

costPremium.description: Estimated cost increase due to restricted competition

localContent.description: Economic benefits retained locally through unrestricted procurement

infrastructureMinister.highImpact: Balance between expertise and local content

analysisPhaseScenesGeneral.text: Welcome to Azuria, where the choices you make will echo for generations... Your team is setting up your office as crucial project documents await your review.
Analyzing stakeholder profiles... With every word exchanged, the balance of power shifts. Choose your approach carefully.
Combing through environmental impact assessments... The future of the Kani River Basin hangs in the balance. What ecological compromises are you willing to make?
Running financial projections... Behind each number lies the livelihood of countless Azurians. Will your decisions bring prosperity or burden?
Mapping the political landscape... Remember, in Azuria, whispers in the corridors of power can become tomorrow's headlines.

stakeholderMeetings.text: President Makena's office is calling... Her support could fast-track the project, but at what cost to your independence? The presidential motorcade is en route.
Finance Minister Odili is reviewing your projections... Each figure will be scrutinized. His pen hovers over the national budget as you wait.
Infrastructure Minister Osei is examining the technical specifications... Her engineering background means no detail will escape her attention. The ministry's technical team is assembling.
The Parliamentary Committee is convening... Political alliances are forming and dissolving even as you prepare your presentation. The chamber buzzes with anticipation.
Community leaders are gathering... Generations have lived alongside the Kani River - will your project honor or disrupt their heritage? The village elders await your arrival.
The Environmental Coalition is assembling evidence... Their dossiers on past projects show they will not be easily swayed by promises. Satellite imagery of the project area is being analyzed.

fundingPhaseScenesGeneral.text: Entering the labyrinth of international finance... The terms you accept today will define Azuria's sovereignty tomorrow. Lenders are circling with competing offers.
Deciphering term sheets... Between the lines of legal jargon lie traps and opportunities. What appears generous now may prove costly later.
Calculating debt sustainability ratios... The weight of national debt stretches into future generations. How heavy a burden can Azuria bear?
Investigating lender track records... Their previous projects tell stories of both development and dependency. History offers warnings if you're willing to listen.
Stress-testing financial models... In the face of uncertainty, prudence is wisdom. What shocks can your financing structure withstand?

lenderSpecificScenes.text: China Eximbank representatives are preparing their presentation... Swift financing comes with strings attached. Their delegation arrives with technical plans already drafted.
Paris Club consortium is assembling their offer... Transparency requirements may expose vulnerabilities but build international credibility. Their compliance team is finalizing conditions.
Commercial bank syndicate is calculating risk premiums... Market rates reflect cold assessment of Azuria's standing. Traders are monitoring your every move.
African Development Bank experts are landing in Nova Zuri... Regional solidarity comes with expectations of exemplary governance. Their social impact team is conducting final assessments.

negotiationPhaseScenesGeneral.text: The negotiation table is being prepared... Every concession has consequences, every demand has a price. Your counterparts are strategizing behind closed doors.
Legal team highlighting contract clauses... The devil hides in legal details, waiting to emerge years after signatures dry. Your advisors flag concerning provisions.
Formulating counteroffers... The dance of diplomacy and finance requires perfect timing. One misstep could collapse months of work.
Stakeholders are weighing in on terms... Competing interests pull you in different directions. Whose voice will you prioritize as the deadline approaches?
Preparing final term acceptance... The path you've chosen will resonate through Azuria's development for decades. The signing ceremony awaits your decision.

dramaticEvents.text: BREAKING NEWS: Parliament announces emergency budget review... National priorities are shifting beneath your feet. Finance Ministry officials work through the night recalculating allocations.
ALERT: Social media activity indicates organized protests forming... Public opinion crystallizes into action. Community organizing spreads from urban centers to rural areas affected by the project.
URGENT: New environmental survey data arriving... Unexpected findings could reshape project viability. Research teams have discovered a previously unknown ecological factor.
DEVELOPING: Political scandal threatens key relationships... Allies may become adversaries overnight. Journalists are investigating connections to the project approval process.
DIPLOMATIC CHANNELS: International organizations express concerns... Global attention focuses on Azuria's choices. UN special rapporteurs have requested project documentation.

consequenceScenes.text: Economic projections updating... Your decisions are creating ripples of prosperity across Azuria. Rural electrification numbers exceed initial estimates.
Fiscal warning indicators flashing... The weight of financial commitments strains the national treasury. Debt service ratios approach concerning thresholds.
Community development metrics improving... Local voices were heard and lives are changing for the better. New schools and healthcare facilities appear in project-adjacent communities.
Social disruption reports increasing... Displacement effects ripple beyond initial estimates. Traditional livelihoods face unforeseen challenges from project implementation.
Environmental regeneration programs exceeding targets... Careful planning yields ecosystem benefits. Biodiversity indicators show positive trends in protected areas.
Ecological monitoring showing concerning trends... Early warnings of unintended consequences emerge. Downstream water quality measurements trigger investigation protocols.

reflectiveScenes.text: Contemplating the project's legacy... When future generations speak of this moment, what story will they tell? Archives preserve your decisions for historians yet unborn.
Your team shows signs of strain... The weight of national development rests on weary shoulders. How much personal sacrifice does progress demand?
Ethical questions surface in quiet moments... In the space between right and wrong lies the question of who benefits and who bears the cost. Your conscience keeps a meticulous ledger.
Gazing toward Azuria's horizon... Beyond immediate outcomes lie transformative possibilities. A generation from now, will this moment be seen as a turning point?

Your reputation forms in the crucible of these decisions... Professional relationships forged here will follow you long after this project concludes. What will colleagues say when they speak your name?
